emerging_technologies.name: AI-driven Personalized Medicine
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems analyze individual genetic, environmental, and lifestyle data to tailor medical treatments.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize healthcare by improving treatment efficacy but raises ethical concerns about data privacy and access equity.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Widespread adoption depends on regulatory approval, public trust in AI, and integration with existing healthcare systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum Internet
emerging_technologies.description: A network that uses quantum entanglement for ultra-secure, high-speed data transfer.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances global security but could render current encryption methods obsolete, requiring a major overhaul of cybersecurity strategies.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial costs, need for specialized hardware, and international cooperation for standardization.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Air Mobility
emerging_technologies.description: Flying vehicles for urban transport, reducing ground traffic congestion.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potentially decreases urban pollution and travel time but introduces new regulatory challenges and safety concerns.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Infrastructure development, regulatory acceptance, public acceptance, and environmental impact assessments.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace Interface
emerging_technologies.description: A fine mesh that integrates with the brain to enhance cognitive functions or control devices directly with thought.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could redefine human capabilities but brings up significant ethical issues around privacy, consent, and human augmentation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Safety concerns, ethical debates, technological maturity, and societal readiness for such integration.

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain-based Energy Trading
emerging_technologies.description: Enables peer-to-peer energy trading, allowing individuals to buy and sell excess renewable energy.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes renewable energy use but could lead to market volatility and requires robust cybersecurity measures.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Legislation, integration with existing energy systems, consumer education, and trust in blockchain technology.

mainstream_technologies.name: 5G Networks
mainstream_technologies.description: Fifth-generation mobile networks providing higher speed, capacity, and lower latency.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Broadly adopted in urban areas with ongoing rural expansion, facing challenges with spectrum allocation and infrastructure.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Homes
mainstream_technologies.description: Homes equipped with IoT devices for automation and energy management.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Increasingly common in new constructions, with retrofit markets growing but adoption varies due to costs and awareness.

epoch_themes.description: Increasing focus on protecting digital identities and securing data transactions.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Heightens public awareness of data rights, but also leads to a cat-and-mouse game with cybercriminals.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push towards more stringent data protection laws and increased cyber defense spending.

epoch_themes.description: Shift towards environmentally sustainable practices in daily life and industry.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Encourages green technology adoption but requires significant behavioral changes and infrastructure overhaul.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growth in green technology investments, policy incentives for sustainability, and public demand for eco-friendly options.
